name: Artificial Intelligence
coreConcepts: Neural Networks and Deep Learning architectures
keyProblems: Addressing bias and fairness in AI models
Ensuring transparency and explainability of AI decisions
Developing robust and secure AI systems against attacks
Managing privacy and data governance in AI applications
Overcoming data scarcity and generalization limitations

timeline: 1950: Alan Turing introduces the 'Turing Test' for machine intelligence.
1956: Dartmouth Conference officially coins the term 'Artificial Intelligence'.
1960s: Early AI research focuses on symbolic methods and expert systems.
1980s: Expert systems achieve commercial success, leading to an 'AI spring'.
1997: Deep Blue chess program defeats world champion Garry Kasparov.
2000s: Rise of statistical machine learning and data-driven approaches.
2012: AlexNet dramatically improves image recognition with deep learning.
2016: AlphaGo defeats Go world champion Lee Sedol, showcasing deep reinforcement learning.
2020: GPT-3 demonstrates remarkable natural language generation capabilities.
2022-Present: Generative AI and Large Language Models see widespread adoption and new applications.
